biography: Salad were a UK-based alternative rock group formed in London in 1992, that included Dutch vocalist/keyboardist Marijne van der Vlugt, bassist Pete Brown, drummer Rob Wakeman (ex-Colenso Parade), and guitarist Paul Kennedy. In 1996, Charley Stone (later of Gay Dad) joined the band as a live guitarist, keyboard player and backing vocalist.
name: Salad

discogs.name: Salad
discogs.profile:
Originated in London, in 1992 by [a=Marijne Van Der Vlugt], the ex-MTV presenter and fashion model, [a=Paul Kennedy], [a=Pete Brown] and [a=Rob Wakeman].  Their first release, the 'Kent EP' was released on their own [l=Waldorf] label, in the summer of '93.  Their jagged alternative pop/indie rock soon attracted the interest of more established labels, being snapped up by Island's '[l=Island Red Label]', after their second single release 'Diminished Clothes'.

In 1999 [a164011] disbanded after being dropped by their label [l8377].

[a=Marijne Van Der Vlugt] and [a=Paul Kennedy] reunited musically again in 2017, performing live acoustic/unplugged sets as [a=Salad Undressed], before eventually crowdfunding a new album under this moniker, 'Good Love Bad Love', as well as issuing unreleased Salad material on 'The Lost Album Vol. 1/2'. 2018 saw the first Salad full band live shows, with the return of [a=Pete Brown] on bass and the addition of two new members, [a=Charley Stone] on guitar/vocals and [a=Donald Ross Skinner] on drums. The first official Salad single in 21 years, 'The Selfishness Of Love', was released in late 2018, with a brand new album, 'The Salad Way', due in early 2019.

Paul and Marijne were previously The Merry Babes https://www.discogs.com/artist/6070901-The-Merry-Babes

theaudiodb.biography_en: Salad were a UK-based alternative rock group formed in London in 1992, that included Dutch vocalist/keyboardist Marijne van der Vlugt, bassist Pete Brown, drummer Rob Wakeman (ex-Colenso Parade), and guitarist Paul Kennedy. In 1996, Charley Stone (later of Gay Dad) joined the band as a live guitarist, keyboard player and backing vocalist.
theaudiodb.name: Salad

discogs.name: Salad
discogs.profile:
Originated in London, in 1992 by [a=Marijne Van Der Vlugt], the ex-MTV presenter and fashion model, [a=Paul Kennedy], [a=Pete Brown] and [a=Rob Wakeman].  Their first release, the 'Kent EP' was released on their own [l=Waldorf] label, in the summer of '93.  Their jagged alternative pop/indie rock soon attracted the interest of more established labels, being snapped up by Island's '[l=Island Red Label]', after their second single release 'Diminished Clothes'.

In 1999 [a164011] disbanded after being dropped by their label [l8377].

[a=Marijne Van Der Vlugt] and [a=Paul Kennedy] reunited musically again in 2017, performing live acoustic/unplugged sets as [a=Salad Undressed], before eventually crowdfunding a new album under this moniker, 'Good Love Bad Love', as well as issuing unreleased Salad material on 'The Lost Album Vol. 1/2'. 2018 saw the first Salad full band live shows, with the return of [a=Pete Brown] on bass and the addition of two new members, [a=Charley Stone] on guitar/vocals and [a=Donald Ross Skinner] on drums. The first official Salad single in 21 years, 'The Selfishness Of Love', was released in late 2018, with a brand new album, 'The Salad Way', due in early 2019.

Paul and Marijne were previously The Merry Babes https://www.discogs.com/artist/6070901-The-Merry-Babes

lastfm.bio_content: [1] Marijne van der Vlugt met guitarist Paul Kennedy whilst studying at film school and knew drummer Rob Wakeman from the house she was living in. They found a bassist and formed a band named The Merry Babes. Marijne sang lead vocals and played keyboards. Salad's first album, Drink Me hit the streets in 1995 and peaked at number 17 in the album charts, no doubt thanks to the bands relentless touring around the UK and Europe. The band split in 1997 after disappointing sales of their second album, Ice Cream. Marijne van der Vlugt is currently in a band named Cowboy Racer, Charley Stone is in Spy51, and Rob Wakeman & Pete Brown are involved with BoreMe.com. [2] Salad is also a Canadian producer/DJ based out of Ottawa, known for jazz- and disco-influenced house music. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.

They found a bassist and formed a band named The Merry Babes. Marijne sang lead vocals and played keyboards. Salad's first album, Drink Me hit the streets in 1995 and peaked at number 17 in the album charts, no doubt thanks to the bands relentless touring around the UK and Europe. The band split in 1997 after disappointing sales of their second album, Ice Cream. Read more on Last.fm

In 1996, Charley Stone (later of Gay Dad) joined the band as a live guitarist, keyboard player and backing vocalist.
